data.q: What does the Same-Origin Policy restrict?
data.explanation: The Same-Origin Policy prevents scripts from accessing data across different origins.
CORS allows controlled access to resources across different origins.
Access-Control-Allow-Origin specifies which origins are allowed to access a resource.

o: Executing malicious scripts in a user's browser
data.explanation: XSS occurs when attackers inject malicious scripts into trusted websites.

data.q: Which practice helps prevent XSS attacks?
data.explanation: Escaping and sanitizing user input helps prevent malicious script injection.

data.q: Which header helps prevent loading unauthorized scripts?
data.explanation: Content Security Policy (CSP) restricts the sources from which scripts can be loaded.
